title: VR-Based Intensive Neuroanatomy Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic life sciences knowledge and fundamental understanding of human anatomy
context.additional_context: Hybrid educational environment combining smartphone-based VR devices with offline workshops.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify major neuroanatomical structures (cerebrum, cerebellum, brainstem, etc.) through VR simulations.
One can explain the nervous system and its key functions using neuroanatomical terminology.
One can visualize and explain interactions between brain regions and functions in 3D space using VR learning tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
